25083 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25084 | /lib/dto/user.ts:
25085 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25086 |  1 | import { z } from 'zod';
25087 |  2 | 
25088 |  3 | export const UserFormSchema = z.object({
25089 |  4 |   id: z.number().optional(),
25090 |  5 |   name: z.string().min(2, { message: 'Name must be at least 2 characters.' }),
25091 |  6 |   email: z.string().email({ message: 'Please enter a valid email.' }),
25092 |  7 |   password: z.string().optional(),
25093 |  8 |   roles: z.array(z.string()).min(1, { message: 'At least one role must be selected.' }),
25094 |  9 | }).refine(data => {
25095 | 10 |     // If it's a new user (no id), password must be a string of at least 8 chars.
25096 | 11 |     if (!data.id) {
25097 | 12 |         return !!data.password && data.password.length >= 8;
25098 | 13 |     }
25099 | 14 |     // If it's an existing user and a password IS provided, it must be at least 8 chars.
25100 | 15 |     // If no password is provided for an existing user, it's valid (means no change).
25101 | 16 |     if (data.id && data.password) {
25102 | 17 |         return data.password.length >= 8;
25103 | 18 |     }
25104 | 19 |     return true;
25105 | 20 | }, {
25106 | 21 |     message: "Password must be at least 8 characters.",
25107 | 22 |     path: ["password"], // Point the error to the password field
25108 | 23 | });
25109 | 24 | 
25110 | 25 | export type UserFormInput = z.infer<typeof UserFormSchema>;

25130 | /lib/neon/api.ts:
25131 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25132 |  1 | // In lib/neon/api.ts
25133 |  2 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
25134 |  3 | import log from '@/lib/logger';
25135 |  4 | 
25136 |  5 | const NEON_API_BASE = 'https://console.neon.tech/api/v2';
25137 |  6 | 
25138 |  7 | export async function createNeonProject(tenantId: string) {
25139 |  8 |   log.info({ tenantId }, '[NeonAPI] Starting project creation process.');
25140 |  9 | 
25141 | 10 |   const headers = {
25142 | 11 |     'Authorization': `Bearer ${env.NEON_API_KEY}`,
25143 | 12 |     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
25144 | 13 |     'Accept': 'application/json',
25145 | 14 |   };
25146 | 15 | 
25147 | 16 |   const projectResponse = await fetch(`${NEON_API_BASE}/projects`, {
25148 | 17 |     method: 'POST',
25149 | 18 |     headers,
25150 | 19 |     body: JSON.stringify({
25151 | 20 |       project: { name: `edux-tenant-${tenantId}` },
25152 | 21 |     }),
25153 | 22 |   });
25154 | 23 | 
25155 | 24 |   if (!projectResponse.ok) {
25156 | 25 |     const errorBody = await projectResponse.text();
25157 | 26 |     log.error({ tenantId, status: projectResponse.status, errorBody }, '[NeonAPI] Failed to create project.');
25158 | 27 |     throw new Error(`Failed to create Neon project: ${errorBody}`);
25159 | 28 |   }
25160 | 29 | 
25161 | 30 |   const responseData = await projectResponse.json();
25162 | 31 |   const project = responseData.project;
25163 | 32 |   const connectionDetails = responseData.connection_uris?.[0];
25164 | 33 |   const connection_uri = connectionDetails?.connection_uri;
25165 | 34 | 
25166 | 35 |   if (!connection_uri) {
25167 | 36 |     log.error({ responseData }, '[NeonAPI] Connection URI could not be extracted from the response.');
25168 | 37 |     throw new Error('Connection URI could not be extracted from the Neon API response.');
25169 | 38 |   }
25170 | 39 | 
25171 | 40 |   log.info({ tenantId, projectId: project.id }, '[NeonAPI] Project created successfully.');
25172 | 41 | 
25173 | 42 |   // The modification to create a pooled string has been removed.
25174 | 43 |   // We will now return the original, direct connection string.
25175 | 44 | 
25176 | 45 |   return {
25177 | 46 |     projectId: project.id,
25178 | 47 |     connectionString: connection_uri,
25179 | 48 |   };
25180 | 49 | }

25184 | /lib/server/tenant.ts:
25185 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25186 |  1 | // lib/server/tenant.ts
25187 |  2 | import { mainDb } from '@/lib/db';
25188 |  3 | import { tenants } from '@/lib/db/schema/shared';
25189 |  4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
25190 |  5 | 
25191 |  6 | export async function validateTenant(tenantId: string) {
25192 |  7 |   console.log(`[Tenant] Validating tenant: ${tenantId}`);
25193 |  8 |   const results = await mainDb.select().from(tenants).where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId)).limit(1);
25194 |  9 |   const tenant = results[0];
25195 | 10 | 
25196 | 11 |   if (!tenant) {
25197 | 12 |     console.error(`[Tenant] Invalid tenant: ${tenantId}`);
25198 | 13 |     throw new Error('Tenant not found');
25199 | 14 |   }
25200 | 15 | 
25201 | 16 |   return tenant;
25202 | 17 | }

25205 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25206 | /lib/session.ts:
25207 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25208 |  1 | import { cookies } from 'next/headers';
25209 |  2 | import { redirect } from 'next/navigation';
25210 |  3 | import { verify } from 'jsonwebtoken';
25211 |  4 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
25212 |  5 | import log from './logger';
25213 |  6 | 
25214 |  7 | export interface UserSession {
25215 |  8 |   tenantId: string;
25216 |  9 |   userId: number;
25217 | 10 |   email: string;
25218 | 11 |   name: string;
25219 | 12 | }
25220 | 13 | 
25221 | 14 | /**
25222 | 15 |  * Retrieves the session from the auth token cookie.
25223 | 16 |  * Redirects to '/login' if the token is missing or invalid.
25224 | 17 |  * This function should be used in Server Components and Server Actions to protect routes.
25225 | 18 |  * @returns {Promise<UserSession>} The decoded user session.
25226 | 19 |  */
25227 | 20 | export async function getSession(): Promise<UserSession> {
25228 | 21 |   const token = (await cookies()).get('authToken')?.value;
25229 | 22 | 
25230 | 23 |   if (!token) {
25231 | 24 |     redirect('/login');
25232 | 25 |   }
25233 | 26 | 
25234 | 27 |   try {
25235 | 28 |     // Verify the token and return the session payload
25236 | 29 |     const session = verify(token, env.JWT_SECRET) as UserSession;
25237 | 30 |     return session;
25238 | 31 |   } catch (e) {
25239 | 32 |     log.error({ error: e }, 'Invalid session token. Redirecting to login.');
25240 | 33 |     // If verification fails, redirect to login
25241 | 34 |     redirect('/login');
25242 | 35 |   }
25243 | 36 | }

25248 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25249 | 1 | import { clsx, type ClassValue } from "clsx"
25250 | 2 | import { twMerge } from "tailwind-merge"
25251 | 3 | 
25252 | 4 | export function cn(...inputs: ClassValue[]) {
25253 | 5 |   return twMerge(clsx(inputs))
25254 | 6 | }

25258 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25259 | /middleware.ts:
25260 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
25261 |  1 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
25262 |  2 | import logger from './lib/logger';
25263 |  3 | 
25264 |  4 | // Extracts the tenant ID from the hostname.
25265 |  5 | const getTenantId = (host: string): string | null => {
25266 |  6 |   const parts = host.split('.');
25267 |  7 | 
25268 |  8 |   // Handles tenant.localhost:3000 in development
25269 |  9 |   if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && parts.length === 2 && parts[1].startsWith('localhost')) {
25270 | 10 |     return parts[0];
25271 | 11 |   }
25272 | 12 | 
25273 | 13 |   // Handles tenant.example.com in production
25274 | 14 |   if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' && parts.length > 1 && parts[0] !== 'www') {
25275 | 15 |     return parts[0];
25276 | 16 |   }
25277 | 17 | 
25278 | 18 |   return null;
25279 | 19 | };
25280 | 20 | 
25281 | 21 | 
25282 | 22 | export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
25283 | 23 |   const host = request.headers.get('host') || '';
25284 | 24 |   const tenantId = getTenantId(host);
25285 | 25 |   const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;
25286 | 26 |   const log = logger.child({ tenantId, pathname });
25287 | 27 | 
25288 | 28 |   log.info('Middleware processing request');
25289 | 29 | 
25290 | 30 |   console.log('Incoming cookies:', request.cookies.getAll());
25291 | 31 |   console.log('TenantId:', tenantId, 'Pathname:', pathname);
25292 | 32 | 
25293 | 33 |   const headers = new Headers(request.headers);
25294 | 34 |   if (tenantId) {
25295 | 35 |     headers.set('x-tenant-id', tenantId);
25296 | 36 |   }
25297 | 37 | 
25298 | 38 |   // Allow public routes regardless of tenant.
25299 | 39 |   if (pathname === '/' || pathname === '/signup') {
25300 | 40 |     return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
25301 | 41 |   }
25302 | 42 | 
25303 | 43 |   // If on a tenant subdomain, allow access to login.
25304 | 44 |   if (tenantId && pathname.startsWith('/login')) {
25305 | 45 |       return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
25306 | 46 |   }
25307 | 47 | 
25308 | 48 |   // All API routes are allowed to pass through for now;
25309 | 49 |   // authentication will be handled at the route level.
25310 | 50 |   if (pathname.startsWith('/api')) {
25311 | 51 |     return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
25312 | 52 |   }
25313 | 53 | 
25314 | 54 |   // For dashboard access, check for an auth token.
25315 | 55 |   const token = request.cookies.get('authToken');
25316 | 56 |   if (pathname.startsWith('/dashboard') && !token) {
25317 | 57 |     log.warn('Access to dashboard denied without token, redirecting to login.');
25318 | 58 |     const loginUrl = new URL('/login', request.url);
25319 | 59 |     return NextResponse.redirect(loginUrl);
25320 | 60 |   }
25321 | 61 | 
25322 | 62 |   return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
25323 | 63 | }
25324 | 64 | 
25325 | 65 | export const config = {
25326 | 66 |   matcher: [
25327 | 67 |     /*
25328 | 68 |      * Match all request paths except for the ones starting with:
25329 | 69 |      * - _next/static (static files)
25330 | 70 |      * - _next/image (image optimization files)
25331 | 71 |      * - favicon.ico (favicon file)
25332 | 72 |      */
25333 | 73 |     '/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico).*)',
25334 | 74 |   ],
25335 | 75 | };
25336 |

25342 | 2 | const nextConfig = {
25343 | 3 |   reactStrictMode: true,
25344 | 4 |   transpilePackages: ['geist'], // Required for Geist font to work correctly
25345 | 5 | };
25346 | 6 | 
25347 | 7 | export default nextConfig;

31554 |  102 | /README.md:
31555 |  103 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

31557 |  105 | 2 | docker exec -it eduspace-postgres psql -U eduspace_user -d eduspace_db
31558 |  106 | 3 | 
31559 |  107 | 
31560 |  108 | 
31561 |  109 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31562 |  110 | /app/api/auth/login/route.ts:
31563 |  111 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31564 |  112 |  1 | // app/api/auth/login/route.ts
31565 |  113 |  2 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
31566 |  114 |  3 | import { getTenantDb } from '@/lib/db';
31567 |  115 |  4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
31568 |  116 |  5 | import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';
31569 |  117 |  6 | import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';
31570 |  118 |  7 | import { LoginDto } from '@/lib/dto/tenant';
31571 |  119 |  8 | import { validateTenant } from '@/lib/server/tenant';
31572 |  120 |  9 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
31573 |  121 | 10 | 
31574 |  122 | 11 | export const runtime = 'nodejs';
31575 |  123 | 12 | 
31576 |  124 | 13 | export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
31577 |  125 | 14 |   try {
31578 |  126 | 15 |     const tenantId = request.headers.get('x-tenant-id');
31579 |  127 | 16 |     if (!tenantId) {
31580 |  128 | 17 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant required' }, { status: 400 });
31581 |  129 | 18 |     }
31582 |  130 | 19 | 
31583 |  131 | 20 |     // Validate tenant existence
31584 |  132 | 21 |     await validateTenant(tenantId);
31585 |  133 | 22 | 
31586 |  134 | 23 |     const body = await request.json();
31587 |  135 | 24 |     const data = LoginDto.parse(body);
31588 |  136 | 25 | 
31589 |  137 | 26 |     console.log(`[API] Login attempt for tenant: ${tenantId}, email: ${data.email}`);
31590 |  138 | 27 | 
31591 |  139 | 28 |     const { db: tenantDb, schema } = await getTenantDb(tenantId);
31592 |  140 | 29 |     const users = await tenantDb.select().from(schema.users).where(eq(schema.users.email, data.email)).limit(1);
31593 |  141 | 30 | 
31594 |  142 | 31 |     if (!users.length) {
31595 |  143 | 32 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Invalid credentials' }, { status: 401 });
31596 |  144 | 33 |     }
31597 |  145 | 34 | 
31598 |  146 | 35 |     const user = users[0];
31599 |  147 | 36 |     const match = await bcrypt.compare(data.password, user.password);
31600 |  148 | 37 |     if (!match) {
31601 |  149 | 38 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Invalid credentials' }, { status: 401 });
31602 |  150 | 39 |     }
31603 |  151 | 40 | 
31604 |  152 | 41 |     const token = jwt.sign({ tenantId, userId: user.id }, env.JWT_SECRET, { expiresIn: '1h' });
31605 |  153 | 42 | 
31606 |  154 | 43 |     const response = NextResponse.json({ message: 'Login successful' });
31607 |  155 | 44 |     response.cookies.set('authToken', token, { httpOnly: true, secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production', sameSite: 'strict', maxAge: 3600 });
31608 |  156 | 45 |     return response;
31609 |  157 | 46 |   } catch (err) {
31610 |  158 | 47 |     console.error('[API] Login failed:', err);
31611 |  159 | 48 |     if (err instanceof Error && err.message === 'Tenant not found') {
31612 |  160 | 49 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant not found' }, { status: 404 });
31613 |  161 | 50 |     }
31614 |  162 | 51 |     return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Internal error' }, { status: 500 });
31615 |  163 | 52 |   }
31616 |  164 | 53 | }
31617 |  165 | 
31618 |  166 | 
31619 |  167 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31620 |  168 | /app/api/tenants/route.ts:
31621 |  169 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31622 |  170 |  1 | // app/api/tenants/route.ts
31623 |  171 |  2 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
31624 |  172 |  3 | import { sharedDb, getTenantDb, executeRawQuery } from '@/lib/db';
31625 |  173 |  4 | import { tenants } from '@/lib/db/schema/shared';
31626 |  174 |  5 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
31627 |  175 |  6 | import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';
31628 |  176 |  7 | import { TenantSignupDto } from '@/lib/dto/tenant';
31629 |  177 |  8 | import z from 'zod/v4';
31630 |  178 |  9 | 
31631 |  179 | 10 | export const runtime = 'nodejs';
31632 |  180 | 11 | 
31633 |  181 | 12 | export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
31634 |  182 | 13 |   try {
31635 |  183 | 14 |     const body = await request.json();
31636 |  184 | 15 |     const data = TenantSignupDto.parse(body);
31637 |  185 | 16 |     const tenantId = data.tenantId; 
31638 |  186 | 17 |     const schemaName = `tenant_${tenantId}`;
31639 |  187 | 18 | 
31640 |  188 | 19 |     console.log(`[API] Creating tenant: ${tenantId}, schema: ${schemaName}`);
31641 |  189 | 20 | 
31642 |  190 | 21 |     const existing = await sharedDb.select().from(tenants).where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId));
31643 |  191 | 22 |     if (existing.length) {
31644 |  192 | 23 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant ID already exists' }, { status: 409 });
31645 |  193 | 24 |     }
31646 |  194 | 25 | 
31647 |  195 | 26 |     // Create schema and users table
31648 |  196 | 27 |     await executeRawQuery(`CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS "${schemaName}";`);
31649 |  197 | 28 |     await executeRawQuery(`
31650 |  198 | 29 |       CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "${schemaName}".users (
31651 |  199 | 30 |         id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
31652 |  200 | 31 |         name TEXT NOT NULL,
31653 |  201 | 32 |         email TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
31654 |  202 | 33 |         password TEXT NOT NULL
31655 |  203 | 34 |       );
31656 |  204 | 35 |     `);
31657 |  205 | 36 | 
31658 |  206 | 37 |     // Insert tenant metadata
31659 |  207 | 38 |     await sharedDb.insert(tenants).values({
31660 |  208 | 39 |       tenantId,
31661 |  209 | 40 |       schemaName,
31662 |  210 | 41 |       name: data.orgName,
31663 |  211 | 42 |     });
31664 |  212 | 43 | 
31665 |  213 | 44 |     // Insert admin user
31666 |  214 | 45 |     const { db: tenantDb, schema } = await getTenantDb(tenantId);
31667 |  215 | 46 |     const hashedPassword = await bcrypt.hash(data.adminPassword, 12);  // Stronger salt (12 rounds)
31668 |  216 | 47 |     await tenantDb.insert(schema.users).values({
31669 |  217 | 48 |       name: data.adminName,
31670 |  218 | 49 |       email: data.adminEmail,
31671 |  219 | 50 |       password: hashedPassword,
31672 |  220 | 51 |     });
31673 |  221 | 52 | 
31674 |  222 | 53 |     console.log(`[API] Tenant created successfully: ${tenantId}`);
31675 |  223 | 54 |     return NextResponse.json({ message: 'Tenant created', tenantId });
31676 |  224 | 55 |   } catch (err) {
31677 |  225 | 56 |     console.error('[API] Tenant creation failed:', err);
31678 |  226 | 57 |     if (err instanceof z.ZodError) {
31679 |  227 | 58 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: err }, { status: 400 });
31680 |  228 | 59 |     }
31681 |  229 | 60 |     return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Internal error' }, { status: 500 });
31682 |  230 | 61 |   }
31683 |  231 | 62 | }
31684 |  232 | 
31685 |  233 | 
31686 |  234 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31687 |  235 | /app/dashboard/page.tsx:
31688 |  236 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31689 |  237 |  1 | // app/dashboard/page.tsx
31690 |  238 |  2 | import { cookies } from 'next/headers';
31691 |  239 |  3 | import { verify } from 'jsonwebtoken';
31692 |  240 |  4 | import { getTenantDb } from '@/lib/db';
31693 |  241 |  5 | 
31694 |  242 |  6 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
31695 |  243 |  7 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
31696 |  244 |  8 | 
31697 |  245 |  9 | export const runtime = 'nodejs';  // Node runtime
31698 |  246 | 10 | 
31699 |  247 | 11 | export default async function DashboardPage() {
31700 |  248 | 12 |   const cookieStore = cookies();
31701 |  249 | 13 |   const token = (await cookieStore).get('authToken')?.value;
31702 |  250 | 14 |   if (!token) {
31703 |  251 | 15 |     return <div>Unauthorized</div>;
31704 |  252 | 16 |   }
31705 |  253 | 17 | 
31706 |  254 | 18 |   let decoded;
31707 |  255 | 19 |   try {
31708 |  256 | 20 |     decoded = verify(token, env.JWT_SECRET) as { tenantId: string; userId: number };
31709 |  257 | 21 | 
31710 |  258 | 22 |     const { db: tenantDb, schema } = await getTenantDb(decoded.tenantId);
31711 |  259 | 23 |     const user = await tenantDb.select().from(schema.users).where(eq(schema.users.id, decoded.userId)).limit(1);
31712 |  260 | 24 | 
31713 |  261 | 25 |     return (
31714 |  262 | 26 |       <div className="min-h-screen p-8 bg-gray-100">
31715 |  263 | 27 |         <h1 className="text-3xl">Welcome to {decoded.tenantId} Dashboard</h1>
31716 |  264 | 28 |         <p>Email: {user[0]?.email}</p>
31717 |  265 | 29 |       </div>
31718 |  266 | 30 |     );
31719 |  267 | 31 |   } catch (err) {
31720 |  268 | 32 |     if (err === 'Tenant not found') {
31721 |  269 | 33 |       return <div>Tenant not found</div>;
31722 |  270 | 34 |     }
31723 |  271 | 35 |     return <div>Invalid token</div>;
31724 |  272 | 36 |   }
31725 |  273 | 37 | }
31726 |  274 |

31903 |  451 | /app/login/page.tsx:
31904 |  452 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31905 |  453 |  1 | // app/login/page.tsx
31906 |  454 |  2 | 'use client';
31907 |  455 |  3 | import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';
31908 |  456 |  4 | import { zodResolver } from '@hookform/resolvers/zod';
31909 |  457 |  5 | import { LoginInput, LoginDto } from '@/lib/dto/tenant';
31910 |  458 |  6 | import { useState } from 'react';
31911 |  459 |  7 | import { useRouter } from 'next/navigation';
31912 |  460 |  8 | 
31913 |  461 |  9 | export default function LoginPage() {
31914 |  462 | 10 |   const [message, setMessage] = useState('');
31915 |  463 | 11 |   const router = useRouter();
31916 |  464 | 12 |   const { register, handleSubmit, formState: { errors } } = useForm<LoginInput>({
31917 |  465 | 13 |     resolver: zodResolver(LoginDto),
31918 |  466 | 14 |   });
31919 |  467 | 15 | 
31920 |  468 | 16 |   const onSubmit = async (data: LoginInput) => {
31921 |  469 | 17 |     const res = await fetch('/api/auth/login', {
31922 |  470 | 18 |       method: 'POST',
31923 |  471 | 19 |       headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
31924 |  472 | 20 |       body: JSON.stringify(data),
31925 |  473 | 21 |     });
31926 |  474 | 22 |     if (res.ok) {
31927 |  475 | 23 |       router.push('/dashboard');
31928 |  476 | 24 |     } else {
31929 |  477 | 25 |       const result = await res.json();
31930 |  478 | 26 |       setMessage(result.error || 'Login failed');
31931 |  479 | 27 |     }
31932 |  480 | 28 |   };
31933 |  481 | 29 | 
31934 |  482 | 30 |   return (
31935 |  483 | 31 |     <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-800">
31936 |  484 | 32 |       <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)} className="bg-green p-8 rounded shadow-md w-96">
31937 |  485 | 33 |         <h1 className="text-2xl mb-4">Login</h1>
31938 |  486 | 34 |         <input {...register('email')} placeholder="Email" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
31939 |  487 | 35 |         {errors.email && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.email.message}</p>}
31940 |  488 | 36 |         <input type="password" {...register('password')} placeholder="Password" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
31941 |  489 | 37 |         {errors.password && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.password.message}</p>}
31942 |  490 | 38 |         <button type="submit" className="bg-blue-500 text-white p-2 w-full">Login</button>
31943 |  491 | 39 |         <p className="mt-2">{message}</p>
31944 |  492 | 40 |       </form>
31945 |  493 | 41 |     </div>
31946 |  494 | 42 |   );
31947 |  495 | 43 | }

31975 |  523 | /app/signup/page.tsx:
31976 |  524 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
31977 |  525 |  1 | // app/signup/page.tsx
31978 |  526 |  2 | 'use client';
31979 |  527 |  3 | import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';
31980 |  528 |  4 | import { zodResolver } from '@hookform/resolvers/zod';
31981 |  529 |  5 | import { TenantSignupInput, TenantSignupDto } from '@/lib/dto/tenant';
31982 |  530 |  6 | import { useState } from 'react';
31983 |  531 |  7 | import { useRouter } from 'next/navigation';
31984 |  532 |  8 | 
31985 |  533 |  9 | export default function SignupPage() {
31986 |  534 | 10 |   const [message, setMessage] = useState('');
31987 |  535 | 11 |   const router = useRouter();
31988 |  536 | 12 |   const { register, handleSubmit, formState: { errors } } = useForm<TenantSignupInput>({
31989 |  537 | 13 |     resolver: zodResolver(TenantSignupDto),
31990 |  538 | 14 |   });
31991 |  539 | 15 | 
31992 |  540 | 16 |   const onSubmit = async (data: TenantSignupInput) => {
31993 |  541 | 17 |     const res = await fetch('/api/tenants', {
31994 |  542 | 18 |       method: 'POST',
31995 |  543 | 19 |       headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
31996 |  544 | 20 |       body: JSON.stringify(data),
31997 |  545 | 21 |     });
31998 |  546 | 22 |     const result = await res.json();
31999 |  547 | 23 |     if (res.ok) {
32000 |  548 | 24 |       setMessage(`Tenant created! Redirecting to dashboard...`);
32001 |  549 | 25 |       // Redirect to tenant dashboard (add to /etc/hosts first)
32002 |  550 | 26 |       window.location.href = `http://${data.tenantId}.localhost:3000/dashboard`;
32003 |  551 | 27 |     } else {
32004 |  552 | 28 |       setMessage(result.error || 'Error creating tenant');
32005 |  553 | 29 |     }
32006 |  554 | 30 |   };
32007 |  555 | 31 | 
32008 |  556 | 32 |   return (
32009 |  557 | 33 |     <div className="min-h-screen flex items-center justify-center bg-gray-800">
32010 |  558 | 34 |       <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)} className="bg-white p-8 rounded shadow-md w-96">
32011 |  559 | 35 |         <h1 className="text-2xl mb-4">Tenant Signup</h1>
32012 |  560 | 36 |         <input {...register('orgName')} placeholder="Organization Name" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
32013 |  561 | 37 |         {errors.orgName && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.orgName.message}</p>}
32014 |  562 | 38 |         <input {...register('tenantId')} placeholder="Tenant ID (e.g., plano-isd)" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
32015 |  563 | 39 |         {errors.tenantId && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.tenantId.message}</p>}
32016 |  564 | 40 |         <input {...register('adminName')} placeholder="Admin Name" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
32017 |  565 | 41 |         {errors.adminName && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.adminName.message}</p>}
32018 |  566 | 42 |         <input {...register('adminEmail')} placeholder="Admin Email" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
32019 |  567 | 43 |         {errors.adminEmail && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.adminEmail.message}</p>}
32020 |  568 | 44 |         <input type="password" {...register('adminPassword')} placeholder="Admin Password" className="mb-2 p-2 border w-full" />
32021 |  569 | 45 |         {errors.adminPassword && <p className="text-red-500">{errors.adminPassword.message}</p>}
32022 |  570 | 46 |         <button type="submit" className="bg-blue-500 text-white p-2 w-full">Signup</button>
32023 |  571 | 47 |         <p className="mt-2 text-center">{message}</p>
32024 |  572 | 48 |       </form>
32025 |  573 | 49 |     </div>
32026 |  574 | 50 |   );
32027 |  575 | 51 | }

32058 |  606 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

32060 |  608 |  2 | import { cva, type VariantProps } from "class-variance-authority"
32061 |  609 |  3 | 
32062 |  610 |  4 | import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"

32361 |  909 |  9 |   baseDirectory: __dirname,
32362 |  910 | 10 | });

32371 |  919 | 
32372 |  920 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32373 |  921 | /lib/db/index.ts:
32374 |  922 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32375 |  923 |  1 | // lib/db/index.ts
32376 |  924 |  2 | import { drizzle } from 'drizzle-orm/node-postgres';
32377 |  925 |  3 | import { Pool, Client } from 'pg';
32378 |  926 |  4 | import { pgSchema } from 'drizzle-orm/pg-core';
32379 |  927 |  5 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
32380 |  928 |  6 | import { tenants } from './schema/shared';
32381 |  929 |  7 | import { usersColumns } from './schema/tenant';
32382 |  930 |  8 | import { env } from '../../env.mjs';
32383 |  931 |  9 | 
32384 |  932 | 10 | // Single shared pool for the entire database (all schemas)
32385 |  933 | 11 | const sharedPool = new Pool({ connectionString: env.DATABASE_URL });
32386 |  934 | 12 | export const sharedDb = drizzle(sharedPool);
32387 |  935 | 13 | 
32388 |  936 | 14 | // Function to get tenant-specific DB (dynamic schema qualification, same pool)
32389 |  937 | 15 | export async function getTenantDb(tenantId: string) {
32390 |  938 | 16 |   console.log(`[DB] Resolving tenant DB for ${tenantId}`);
32391 |  939 | 17 |   const tenant = await sharedDb.select().from(tenants).where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId)).limit(1);
32392 |  940 | 18 |   if (!tenant.length) {
32393 |  941 | 19 |     console.error(`[DB] Tenant not found: ${tenantId}`);
32394 |  942 | 20 |     throw new Error('Tenant not found');
32395 |  943 | 21 |   }
32396 |  944 | 22 |   const schemaName = tenant[0].schemaName;
32397 |  945 | 23 | 
32398 |  946 | 24 |   const tenantSchema = pgSchema(schemaName);
32399 |  947 | 25 |   const users = tenantSchema.table('users', usersColumns);
32400 |  948 | 26 | 
32401 |  949 | 27 |   const tenantDb = drizzle(sharedPool, { schema: { users } });
32402 |  950 | 28 |   console.log(`[DB] Tenant DB initialized for schema: ${schemaName}`);
32403 |  951 | 29 |   return { db: tenantDb, schema: { users } };
32404 |  952 | 30 | }
32405 |  953 | 31 | 
32406 |  954 | 32 | // For raw queries (e.g., schema creation)
32407 |  955 | 33 | export async function executeRawQuery(query: string) {
32408 |  956 | 34 |   const client = new Client({ connectionString: env.DATABASE_URL });
32409 |  957 | 35 |   await client.connect();
32410 |  958 | 36 |   try {
32411 |  959 | 37 |     await client.query(query);
32412 |  960 | 38 |     console.log(`[DB] Executed raw query: ${query.substring(0, 50)}...`);
32413 |  961 | 39 |   } finally {
32414 |  962 | 40 |     await client.end();
32415 |  963 | 41 |   }
32416 |  964 | 42 | }
32417 |  965 | 43 | 
32418 |  966 | 44 | // Export types
32419 |  967 | 45 | export type TenantDb = Awaited<ReturnType<typeof getTenantDb>>;
32420 |  968 | 
32421 |  969 | 
32422 |  970 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32423 |  971 | /lib/db/schema/shared.ts:
32424 |  972 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32425 |  973 |  1 | // lib/db/schema/shared.ts
32426 |  974 |  2 | import { pgTable, serial, text, timestamp } from 'drizzle-orm/pg-core';
32427 |  975 |  3 | 
32428 |  976 |  4 | export const tenants = pgTable('tenants', {
32429 |  977 |  5 |   id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
32430 |  978 |  6 |   tenantId: text('tenant_id').notNull().unique(),
32431 |  979 |  7 |   schemaName: text('schema_name').notNull(),
32432 |  980 |  8 |   name: text('name').notNull(),
32433 |  981 |  9 |   createdAt: timestamp('created_at').defaultNow().notNull(),
32434 |  982 | 10 | });

32442 |  990 | 3 | 
32443 |  991 | 4 | export const usersColumns = {
32444 |  992 | 5 |   id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
32445 |  993 | 6 |   name: text('name').notNull(),
32446 |  994 | 7 |   email: text('email').notNull().unique(),
32447 |  995 | 8 |   password: text('password').notNull(),  // Hashed
32448 |  996 | 9 | };

32455 | 1003 |  2 | import { z } from 'zod';
32456 | 1004 |  3 | 
32457 | 1005 |  4 | export const TenantSignupDto = z.object({
32458 | 1006 |  5 |   orgName: z.string().min(3, 'Org name must be at least 3 characters').max(50),
32459 | 1007 |  6 |   tenantId: z.string().min(3, 'Tenant ID must be at least 3 characters').max(50).regex(/^[a-z0-9-]+$/, 'Tenant ID must be lowercase letters, numbers, or hyphens'),
32460 | 1008 |  7 |   adminName: z.string().min(3, 'Admin name must be at least 3 characters').max(100),
32461 | 1009 |  8 |   adminEmail: z.string().email('Invalid email'),
32462 | 1010 |  9 |   adminPassword: z.string().min(8, 'Password must be at least 8 characters'),
32463 | 1011 | 10 | });
32464 | 1012 | 11 | 
32465 | 1013 | 12 | export const LoginDto = z.object({
32466 | 1014 | 13 |   email: z.string().email('Invalid email'),
32467 | 1015 | 14 |   password: z.string().min(8, 'Password must be at least 8 characters'),
32468 | 1016 | 15 | });
32469 | 1017 | 16 | 
32470 | 1018 | 17 | export type TenantSignupInput = z.infer<typeof TenantSignupDto>;
32471 | 1019 | 18 | export type LoginInput = z.infer<typeof LoginDto>;

32473 | 1021 | 
32474 | 1022 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32475 | 1023 | /lib/server/tenant.ts:
32476 | 1024 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32477 | 1025 |  1 | // lib/server/tenant.ts
32478 | 1026 |  2 | import { sharedDb } from '@/lib/db';
32479 | 1027 |  3 | import { tenants } from '@/lib/db/schema/shared';
32480 | 1028 |  4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
32481 | 1029 |  5 | 
32482 | 1030 |  6 | export async function validateTenant(tenantId: string) {
32483 | 1031 |  7 |   console.log(`[Tenant] Validating tenant: ${tenantId}`);
32484 | 1032 |  8 |   const tenant = await sharedDb.select().from(tenants).where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId)).limit(1);
32485 | 1033 |  9 |   if (!tenant.length) {
32486 | 1034 | 10 |     console.error(`[Tenant] Invalid tenant: ${tenantId}`);
32487 | 1035 | 11 |     throw new Error('Tenant not found');
32488 | 1036 | 12 |   }
32489 | 1037 | 13 |   return tenant[0];
32490 | 1038 | 14 | }
32491 | 1039 | 
32492 | 1040 | 
32493 | 1041 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32494 | 1042 | /lib/utils.ts:
32495 | 1043 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32496 | 1044 | 1 | import { clsx, type ClassValue } from "clsx"
32497 | 1045 | 2 | import { twMerge } from "tailwind-merge"
32498 | 1046 | 3 | 
32499 | 1047 | 4 | export function cn(...inputs: ClassValue[]) {
32500 | 1048 | 5 |   return twMerge(clsx(inputs))
32501 | 1049 | 6 | }
32502 | 1050 | 7 | 
32503 | 1051 | 
32504 | 1052 | 
32505 | 1053 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32506 | 1054 | /middleware.ts:
32507 | 1055 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
32508 | 1056 |  1 | // middleware.ts
32509 | 1057 |  2 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
32510 | 1058 |  3 | 
32511 | 1059 |  4 | export async function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
32512 | 1060 |  5 |   const host = request.headers.get('host') || '';
32513 | 1061 |  6 |   const parts = host.split('.');
32514 | 1062 |  7 |   const tenantId = parts.length > 2 ? parts[0] : null;  // e.g., tenant1.localhost:3000 → tenant1
32515 | 1063 |  8 | 
32516 | 1064 |  9 |   console.log(`[Middleware] Host: ${host}, Tenant ID: ${tenantId}`);
32517 | 1065 | 10 | 
32518 | 1066 | 11 |   // Public routes (no tenant needed) - added '/'
32519 | 1067 | 12 |   const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname;
32520 | 1068 | 13 |   if (!tenantId && (pathname === '/' || pathname.startsWith('/signup') || pathname.startsWith('/login') || pathname.startsWith('/api/tenants') || pathname.startsWith('/api/auth'))) {
32521 | 1069 | 14 |     return NextResponse.next();
32522 | 1070 | 15 |   }
32523 | 1071 | 16 | 
32524 | 1072 | 17 |   console.log(`[Middleware] Tenant ID found: ${tenantId}`);
32525 | 1073 | 18 |   if (!tenantId) {
32526 | 1074 | 19 |     console.error('[Middleware] No tenant ID found');
32527 | 1075 | 20 |     return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant not found' }, { status: 404 });
32528 | 1076 | 21 |   }
32529 | 1077 | 22 | 
32530 | 1078 | 23 |   // Set tenant context in headers (no validation here)
32531 | 1079 | 24 |   const headers = new Headers(request.headers);
32532 | 1080 | 25 |   headers.set('x-tenant-id', tenantId);
32533 | 1081 | 26 |   console.log(`[Middleware] Setting x-tenant-id header: ${tenantId}`);
32534 | 1082 | 27 |   console.log(`[Middleware] headers: ${JSON.stringify(Array.from(headers.entries()))}`);
32535 | 1083 | 28 | 
32536 | 1084 | 29 |   return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
32537 | 1085 | 30 | }
32538 | 1086 | 31 | 
32539 | 1087 | 32 | export const config = {
32540 | 1088 | 33 |   matcher: ['/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico).*)'],
32541 | 1089 | 34 | };

40817 |  5 | import 'dotenv/config';
40818 |  6 | 
40819 |  7 | async function main() {
40820 |  8 |   const connectionString = process.env.TENANT_DATABASE_URL;
40821 |  9 | 
40822 | 10 |   if (!connectionString) {
40823 | 11 |     throw new Error('TENANT_DATABASE_URL environment variable is not set.');
40824 | 12 |   }
40825 | 13 | 
40826 | 14 |   // Use postgres 'on-the-fly' with max 1 connection for migrations
40827 | 15 |   const migrationClient = postgres(connectionString, { max: 1 });
40828 | 16 |   const db = drizzle(migrationClient);
40829 | 17 | 
40830 | 18 |   console.log('Running migrations for tenant...');
40831 | 19 | 
40832 | 20 |   await migrate(db, { migrationsFolder: './drizzle/tenant' });
40833 | 21 | 
40834 | 22 |   console.log('Migrations completed successfully.');
40835 | 23 | 
40836 | 24 |   await migrationClient.end();
40837 | 25 |   process.exit(0);
40838 | 26 | }
40839 | 27 | 
40840 | 28 | main().catch((err) => {
40841 | 29 |   console.error('Migration failed:', err);
40842 | 30 |   process.exit(1);
40843 | 31 | });
40844 | 
40845 |

 8 |     NEON_API_KEY: z.string().min(1),
 9 |     NEON_ORG_ID: z.string().min(1),

11 |

15 |     POSTGRES_URL: process.env.POSTGRES_URL,

 9 |   baseDirectory: __dirname,
10 | });

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/hooks/use-mobile.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | "use client"
 2 | 
 3 | import { useEffect, useState } from "react"
 4 | 
 5 | export function useIsMobile(query: string = "(max-width: 768px)") {
 6 |   const [isMobile, setIsMobile] = useState(false)
 7 | 
 8 |   useEffect(() => {
 9 |     const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia(query)
10 |     const handleChange = () => setIsMobile(mediaQuery.matches)
11 | 
12 |     handleChange() // Set initial value
13 |     mediaQuery.addEventListener("change", handleChange)
14 | 
15 |     return () => {
16 |       mediaQuery.removeEventListener("change", handleChange)
17 |     }
18 |   }, [query])
19 | 
20 |   return isMobile
21 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/actions/auth.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | 'use server';
 2 | 
 3 | import { cookies } from "next/headers";
 4 | import { redirect } from "next/navigation";
 5 | 
 6 | export async function logout() {
 7 |   // Destroy the session cookie by setting its expiration date to the past
 8 |   (await
 9 |     // Destroy the session cookie by setting its expiration date to the past
10 |     cookies()).set("authToken", "", { expires: new Date(0) });
11 |   
12 |   // Redirect to the login page
13 |   redirect('/login');
14 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/actions/role.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | 'use server';
 2 | 
 3 | import { cookies } from 'next/headers';
 4 | import { redirect } from 'next/navigation';
 5 | import { verify } from 'jsonwebtoken';
 6 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 7 | import { getTenantDb } from '@/lib/db';
 8 | import { revalidatePath } from 'next/cache';
 9 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
10 | import log from '../logger';
11 | import { roles } from '../db/schema/tenant';
12 | import { RoleFormSchema } from '../dto/role';
13 | 
14 | interface UserSession {
15 |   tenantId: string;
16 |   userId: number;
17 | }
18 | 
19 | async function getSession() {
20 |   const token = (await cookies()).get('authToken')?.value;
21 |   if (!token) {
22 |     redirect('/login');
23 |   }
24 |   try {
25 |     return verify(token, env.JWT_SECRET) as UserSession;
26 |   } catch (e) {
27 |     log.error({ error: e }, 'Invalid session token');
28 |     redirect('/login');
29 |   }
30 | }
31 | 
32 | export async function getRoles() {
33 |     const session = await getSession();
34 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
35 |     return db.query.roles.findMany();
36 | }
37 | 
38 | export async function upsertRole(data: unknown) {
39 |     const session = await getSession();
40 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
41 | 
42 |     const validatedFields = RoleFormSchema.safeParse(data);
43 | 
44 |     if (!validatedFields.success) {
45 |         return { success: false, message: 'Invalid role data.' };
46 |     }
47 | 
48 |     const { id, name, description } = validatedFields.data;
49 | 
50 |     try {
51 |         if (id) {
52 |             await db.update(roles).set({ name, description }).where(eq(roles.id, id));
53 |         } else {
54 |             await db.insert(roles).values({ name, description });
55 |         }
56 |         revalidatePath('/dashboard/roles');
57 |         revalidatePath('/dashboard/users'); // Also revalidate users page in case roles changed
58 |         return { success: true, message: `Role successfully ${id ? 'updated' : 'created'}.` };
59 |     } catch (error) {
60 |         log.error({ error }, 'Failed to upsert role');
61 |         return { success: false, message: 'Failed to save role.' };
62 |     }
63 | }
64 | 
65 | export async function deleteRole(roleId: number) {
66 |     const session = await getSession();
67 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
68 | 
69 |     try {
70 |         // You might want to add a check here to ensure the role is not in use
71 |         await db.delete(roles).where(eq(roles.id, roleId));
72 |         revalidatePath('/dashboard/roles');
73 |         revalidatePath('/dashboard/users');
74 |         return { success: true, message: 'Role deleted successfully.' };
75 |     } catch (error) {
76 |         log.error({ error, roleId }, 'Failed to delete role');
77 |         return { success: false, message: 'Failed to delete role. It might be in use.' };
78 |     }
79 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/actions/settings.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | 'use server';
 2 | 
 3 | import { revalidatePath } from 'next/cache';
 4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 5 | import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';
 6 | import log from '../logger';
 7 | import { getSession } from '../session';
 8 | import { getTenantDb } from '../db';
 9 | import { users } from '../db/schema/tenant';
10 | import { UpdateProfileSchema, UpdatePasswordSchema } from '../dto/settings';
11 | import { logout } from './auth';
12 | 
13 | // Action to update the user's profile information
14 | export async function updateProfileAction(data: unknown) {
15 |     const session = await getSession();
16 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
17 | 
18 |     const validatedFields = UpdateProfileSchema.safeParse(data);
19 |     if (!validatedFields.success) {
20 |         return { success: false, message: "Invalid data provided." };
21 |     }
22 | 
23 |     const { name, email } = validatedFields.data;
24 | 
25 |     try {
26 |         await db.update(users)
27 |             .set({ name, email })
28 |             .where(eq(users.id, session.userId));
29 |         
30 |         revalidatePath('/dashboard/settings');
31 |         return { success: true, message: "Profile updated successfully." };
32 | 
33 |     } catch (error: unknown) {
34 |         if (error instanceof Error && 'code' in error && error.code === '23505') {
35 |             return { success: false, message: "This email is already in use by another account." };
36 |         }
37 |         log.error({ error }, "Failed to update user profile");
38 |         return { success: false, message: "An unexpected error occurred." };
39 |     }
40 | }
41 | 
42 | // Action to update the user's password
43 | export async function updatePasswordAction(data: unknown) {
44 |     const session = await getSession();
45 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
46 | 
47 |     const validatedFields = UpdatePasswordSchema.safeParse(data);
48 |     if (!validatedFields.success) {
49 |         return { success: false, message: "Invalid data provided." };
50 |     }
51 | 
52 |     const { currentPassword, newPassword } = validatedFields.data;
53 | 
54 |     try {
55 |         const user = await db.query.users.findFirst({ where: eq(users.id, session.userId) });
56 |         if (!user) {
57 |             return { success: false, message: "User not found." };
58 |         }
59 | 
60 |         const isPasswordValid = await bcrypt.compare(currentPassword, user.password);
61 |         if (!isPasswordValid) {
62 |             return { success: false, message: "The current password you entered is incorrect." };
63 |         }
64 | 
65 |         const hashedNewPassword = await bcrypt.hash(newPassword, 12);
66 |         await db.update(users)
67 |             .set({ password: hashedNewPassword })
68 |             .where(eq(users.id, session.userId));
69 | 
70 |         return { success: true, message: "Password updated successfully." };
71 | 
72 |     } catch (error) {
73 |         log.error({ error }, "Failed to update user password");
74 |         return { success: false, message: "An unexpected error occurred." };
75 |     }
76 | }
77 | 
78 | // Action to delete the user's own account
79 | export async function deleteAccountAction() {
80 |     const session = await getSession();
81 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
82 | 
83 |     try {
84 |         await db.delete(users).where(eq(users.id, session.userId));
85 |         // After deletion, log the user out and redirect
86 |         await logout();
87 |         return { success: true, message: "Your account has been deleted." };
88 |     } catch (error) {
89 |         log.error({ error, userId: session.userId }, "Failed to delete user account");
90 |         return { success: false, message: "An unexpected error occurred." };
91 |     }
92 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/actions/user.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | 'use server';
  2 | 
  3 | import { cookies } from 'next/headers';
  4 | import { redirect } from 'next/navigation';
  5 | import { verify } from 'jsonwebtoken';
  6 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
  7 | import { getTenantDb } from '@/lib/db';
  8 | import { UserFormSchema, type UserFormInput } from '@/lib/dto/user';
  9 | import { users, usersToRoles } from '@/lib/db/schema/tenant';
 10 | import { revalidatePath } from 'next/cache';
 11 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 12 | import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';
 13 | import log from '../logger';
 14 | 
 15 | interface UserSession {
 16 |   tenantId: string;
 17 |   userId: number;
 18 | }
 19 | 
 20 | function isDatabaseError(error: unknown): error is { code: string; message: string } {
 21 |     return typeof error === 'object' && error !== null && 'code' in error;
 22 | }
 23 | 
 24 | async function getSession() {
 25 |   const token = (await cookies()).get('authToken')?.value;
 26 |   if (!token) {
 27 |     redirect('/login');
 28 |   }
 29 |   try {
 30 |     return verify(token, env.JWT_SECRET) as UserSession;
 31 |   } catch (e) {
 32 |     log.error({ error: e }, 'Invalid session token');
 33 |     redirect('/login');
 34 |   }
 35 | }
 36 | 
 37 | export async function getUsersWithRoles() {
 38 |     const session = await getSession();
 39 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
 40 |     
 41 |     const usersWithRoles = await db.query.users.findMany({
 42 |         with: {
 43 |             usersToRoles: {
 44 |                 with: {
 45 |                     role: true
 46 |                 }
 47 |             }
 48 |         }
 49 |     });
 50 | 
 51 |     return usersWithRoles.map(user => ({
 52 |        ...user,
 53 |         roles: user.usersToRoles.map(ur => ur.role.name).join(', ')
 54 |     }));
 55 | }
 56 | 
 57 | // The invalid re-export has been removed from here.
 58 | 
 59 | export async function upsertUserAction(data: UserFormInput) {
 60 |     const session = await getSession();
 61 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
 62 | 
 63 |     const { id, name, email, password, roles: roleIdsStr } = data;
 64 |     const roleIds = roleIdsStr.map(Number);
 65 |     
 66 |     try {
 67 |         await db.transaction(async (tx) => {
 68 |             if (id) { // Update existing user
 69 |                 const userToUpdate: { name: string; email: string; password?: string } = { name, email };
 70 |                 if (password) {
 71 |                     const hashedPassword = await bcrypt.hash(password, 12);
 72 |                     userToUpdate.password = hashedPassword;
 73 |                 }
 74 |                 
 75 |                 await tx.update(users).set(userToUpdate).where(eq(users.id, id));
 76 |                 
 77 |                 await tx.delete(usersToRoles).where(eq(usersToRoles.userId, id));
 78 |                 if (roleIds.length > 0) {
 79 |                     await tx.insert(usersToRoles).values(roleIds.map(roleId => ({
 80 |                         userId: id,
 81 |                         roleId: roleId
 82 |                     })));
 83 |                 }
 84 | 
 85 |             } else { // Create new user
 86 |                 if (!password) throw new Error("Password is required for new users.");
 87 |                 
 88 |                 const hashedPassword = await bcrypt.hash(password, 12);
 89 |                 
 90 |                 const [newUser] = await tx.insert(users).values({
 91 |                     name,
 92 |                     email,
 93 |                     password: hashedPassword,
 94 |                 }).returning({ id: users.id });
 95 | 
 96 |                 if (roleIds.length > 0) {
 97 |                     await tx.insert(usersToRoles).values(roleIds.map(roleId => ({
 98 |                         userId: newUser.id,
 99 |                         roleId: roleId
100 |                     })));
101 |                 }
102 |             }
103 |         });
104 |     } catch (error: unknown) {
105 |         log.error({ error }, 'Failed to upsert user');
106 |         if (isDatabaseError(error) && error.code === '23505') {
107 |             return { 
108 |                 success: false, 
109 |                 message: "A user with this email already exists.",
110 |                 errors: { email: ["This email is already in use."] }
111 |             };
112 |         }
113 |         return { success: false, message: "An unexpected error occurred." };
114 |     }
115 | 
116 |     revalidatePath('/dashboard/users');
117 |     return { success: true, message: `User successfully ${id ? 'updated' : 'created'}.` };
118 | }
119 | 
120 | export async function deleteUserAction(userId: number) {
121 |     const session = await getSession();
122 |     const db = await getTenantDb(session.tenantId);
123 | 
124 |     if (userId === session.userId) {
125 |         return { success: false, message: "You cannot delete your own account." };
126 |     }
127 | 
128 |     try {
129 |         await db.delete(users).where(eq(users.id, userId));
130 |         revalidatePath('/dashboard/users');
131 |         return { success: true, message: "User deleted successfully." };
132 |     } catch (error) {
133 |         log.error({ error, userId }, 'Failed to delete user');
134 |         return { success: false, message: "Failed to delete user." };
135 |     }
136 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/crypto.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { createCipheriv, createDecipheriv, scryptSync, randomBytes } from 'crypto';
 2 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 3 | 
 4 | const ALGORITHM = 'aes-256-gcm';
 5 | const IV_LENGTH = 16;
 6 | const TAG_LENGTH = 16;
 7 | const KEY = scryptSync(env.ENCRYPTION_KEY, 'salt', 32);
 8 | 
 9 | export function encrypt(text: string): string {
10 |   const iv = randomBytes(IV_LENGTH);
11 |   const cipher = createCipheriv(ALGORITHM, KEY, iv);
12 |   const encrypted = Buffer.concat([cipher.update(text, 'utf8'), cipher.final()]);
13 |   const tag = cipher.getAuthTag();
14 |   return Buffer.concat([iv, tag, encrypted]).toString('hex');
15 | }
16 | 
17 | export function decrypt(encryptedText: string): string {
18 |   const data = Buffer.from(encryptedText, 'hex');
19 |   const iv = data.slice(0, IV_LENGTH);
20 |   const tag = data.slice(IV_LENGTH, IV_LENGTH + TAG_LENGTH);
21 |   const encrypted = data.slice(IV_LENGTH + TAG_LENGTH);
22 |   const decipher = createDecipheriv(ALGORITHM, KEY, iv);
23 |   decipher.setAuthTag(tag);
24 |   const decrypted = Buffer.concat([decipher.update(encrypted), decipher.final()]);
25 |   return decrypted.toString('utf8');
26 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/db/index.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // lib/db/index.ts
 2 | import { drizzle, NodePgDatabase } from 'drizzle-orm/node-postgres';
 3 | import { Pool } from 'pg';
 4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 5 | import { tenants } from './schema/shared';
 6 | import * as tenantSchema from './schema/tenant';
 7 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 8 | import { decrypt } from '@/lib/crypto';
 9 | import log from '@/lib/logger';
10 | 
11 | // 1. Main DB Client (for managing tenant metadata)
12 | const mainPool = new Pool({ connectionString: env.POSTGRES_URL });
13 | export const mainDb = drizzle(mainPool, { schema: { tenants } });
14 | 
15 | // 2. Tenant DB Client Cache
16 | const tenantDbCache = new Map<string, NodePgDatabase<typeof tenantSchema>>();
17 | 
18 | // 3. Function to get a tenant-specific DB client
19 | export async function getTenantDb(tenantId: string): Promise<NodePgDatabase<typeof tenantSchema>> {
20 |   if (tenantDbCache.has(tenantId)) {
21 |     log.info({ tenantId }, 'Tenant DB client cache HIT.');
22 |     return tenantDbCache.get(tenantId)!;
23 |   }
24 |   log.info({ tenantId }, 'Tenant DB client cache MISS.');
25 | 
26 |   const results = await mainDb
27 |     .select({ connectionString: tenants.connectionString })
28 |     .from(tenants)
29 |     .where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId))
30 |     .limit(1);
31 | 
32 |   // --- Start of Fix ---
33 |   const tenantData = results[0]; // Access the first element of the array
34 | 
35 |   if (!tenantData) {
36 |     log.error({ tenantId }, 'Tenant not found in main database.');
37 |     throw new Error('Tenant not found');
38 |   }
39 | 
40 |   const decryptedConnectionString = decrypt(tenantData.connectionString);
41 |   // --- End of Fix ---
42 | 
43 |   const tenantPool = new Pool({ connectionString: decryptedConnectionString });
44 |   const tenantDb = drizzle(tenantPool, { schema: tenantSchema });
45 | 
46 |   tenantDbCache.set(tenantId, tenantDb);
47 |   log.info({ tenantId }, 'Created and cached new tenant DB client.');
48 | 
49 |   return tenantDb;
50 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/db/migrate.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // In /lib/db/migrate.ts
 2 | import { drizzle } from 'drizzle-orm/postgres-js';
 3 | import { migrate } from 'drizzle-orm/postgres-js/migrator';
 4 | import postgres from 'postgres';
 5 | import log from '@/lib/logger';
 6 | 
 7 | export async function runTenantMigrations(connectionString: string) {
 8 |   // Use postgres 'on-the-fly' with max 1 connection for migrations
 9 |   const migrationClient = postgres(connectionString, { max: 1 });
10 |   const db = drizzle(migrationClient);
11 | 
12 |   try {
13 |     log.info('Starting tenant migration...');
14 |     await migrate(db, { migrationsFolder: './drizzle/tenant' }); // Assumes tenant migrations are in 'drizzle/tenant'
15 |     log.info('Tenant migration completed successfully.');
16 |   } catch (error) {
17 |     log.error({ error }, 'Tenant migration failed.');
18 |     // Re-throw the error to ensure the API call fails loudly
19 |     throw new Error('Could not run tenant migrations.');
20 |   } finally {
21 |     // Ensure the connection is closed
22 |     await migrationClient.end();
23 |   }
24 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/db/schema/shared.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { pgTable, serial, text, timestamp } from 'drizzle-orm/pg-core';
 2 | 
 3 | export const tenants = pgTable('tenants', {
 4 |   id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
 5 |   tenantId: text('tenant_id').notNull().unique(),
 6 |   name: text('name').notNull(),
 7 |   neonProjectId: text('neon_project_id').notNull().unique(),
 8 |   connectionString: text('connection_string').notNull(), // Encrypted
 9 |   createdAt: timestamp('created_at').defaultNow().notNull(),
10 | });


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/db/schema/tenant.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { serial, text, pgTable, integer, timestamp, primaryKey } from 'drizzle-orm/pg-core';
 2 | import { relations } from 'drizzle-orm';
 3 | 
 4 | // Existing users table
 5 | export const users = pgTable('users', {
 6 |   id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
 7 |   name: text('name').notNull(),
 8 |   email: text('email').notNull().unique(),
 9 |   password: text('password').notNull(),
10 | });
11 | 
12 | // New roles table
13 | export const roles = pgTable('roles', {
14 |     id: serial('id').primaryKey(),
15 |     name: text('name').notNull().unique(),
16 |     description: text('description'),
17 |     createdAt: timestamp('created_at').defaultNow().notNull(),
18 | });
19 | 
20 | // New users_to_roles join table
21 | export const usersToRoles = pgTable('users_to_roles', {
22 |     userId: integer('user_id').notNull().references(() => users.id, { onDelete: 'cascade' }),
23 |     roleId: integer('role_id').notNull().references(() => roles.id, { onDelete: 'cascade' }),
24 | }, (t) => ({
25 |     pk: primaryKey({ columns: [t.userId, t.roleId] }),
26 | }));
27 | 
28 | // --- RELATIONS ---
29 | 
30 | export const usersRelations = relations(users, ({ many }) => ({
31 |     usersToRoles: many(usersToRoles),
32 | }));
33 | 
34 | export const rolesRelations = relations(roles, ({ many }) => ({
35 |     usersToRoles: many(usersToRoles),
36 | }));
37 | 
38 | export const usersToRolesRelations = relations(usersToRoles, ({ one }) => ({
39 |     role: one(roles, {
40 |         fields: [usersToRoles.roleId],
41 |         references: [roles.id],
42 |     }),
43 |     user: one(users, {
44 |         fields: [usersToRoles.userId],
45 |         references: [users.id],
46 |     }),
47 | }));
48 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/dto/role.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1 | import { z } from 'zod';
2 | 
3 | export const RoleFormSchema = z.object({
4 |   id: z.number().optional(),
5 |   name: z.string().min(2, { message: 'Role name must be at least 2 characters.' }),
6 |   description: z.string().optional(),
7 | });
8 | 
9 | export type RoleFormInput = z.infer<typeof RoleFormSchema>;


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/dto/settings.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { z } from 'zod';
 2 | 
 3 | // Schema for updating the user's general profile information
 4 | export const UpdateProfileSchema = z.object({
 5 |   name: z.string().min(3, { message: "Name must be at least 3 characters." }),
 6 |   email: z.string().email({ message: "Please enter a valid email address." }),
 7 | });
 8 | export type UpdateProfileInput = z.infer<typeof UpdateProfileSchema>;
 9 | 
10 | 
11 | // Schema for updating the user's password
12 | export const UpdatePasswordSchema = z.object({
13 |   currentPassword: z.string().min(1, { message: "Current password is required." }),
14 |   newPassword: z.string().min(8, { message: "New password must be at least 8 characters." }),
15 | });
16 | export type UpdatePasswordInput = z.infer<typeof UpdatePasswordSchema>;
17 | 
18 | // Schema for the danger zone account deletion
19 | export const DeleteAccountSchema = z.object({
20 |     confirm: z.string().refine((val) => val === 'delete my account', {
21 |         message: "You must type 'delete my account' to confirm.",
22 |     }),
23 | });
24 | export type DeleteAccountInput = z.infer<typeof DeleteAccountSchema>;


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/dto/tenant.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // lib/dto/tenant.ts
 2 | import { z } from 'zod';
 3 | 
 4 | export const TenantSignupDto = z.object({
 5 |   orgName: z.string().min(3, 'Org name must be at least 3 characters').max(50),
 6 |   tenantId: z.string().min(3, 'Tenant ID must be at least 3 characters').max(50).regex(/^[a-z0-9-]+$/, 'Tenant ID must be lowercase letters, numbers, or hyphens'),
 7 |   adminName: z.string().min(3, 'Admin name must be at least 3 characters').max(100),
 8 |   adminEmail: z.string().email('Invalid email'),
 9 |   adminPassword: z.string().min(8, 'Password must be at least 8 characters'),
10 | });
11 | 
12 | export const LoginDto = z.object({
13 |   email: z.string().email('Invalid email'),
14 |   password: z.string().min(8, 'Password must be at least 8 characters'),
15 | });
16 | 
17 | export const LoginWithTenantDto = LoginDto.extend({
18 |   tenantId: z.string().min(1, 'Tenant ID is required'),
19 | });
20 | 
21 | export type TenantSignupInput = z.infer<typeof TenantSignupDto>;
22 | export type LoginInput = z.infer<typeof LoginDto>;
23 | export type LoginWithTenantInput = z.infer<typeof LoginWithTenantDto>;


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/dto/user.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { z } from 'zod';
 2 | 
 3 | export const UserFormSchema = z.object({
 4 |   id: z.number().optional(),
 5 |   name: z.string().min(2, { message: 'Name must be at least 2 characters.' }),
 6 |   email: z.string().email({ message: 'Please enter a valid email.' }),
 7 |   password: z.string().optional(),
 8 |   roles: z.array(z.string()).min(1, { message: 'At least one role must be selected.' }),
 9 | }).refine(data => {
10 |     // If it's a new user (no id), password must be a string of at least 8 chars.
11 |     if (!data.id) {
12 |         return !!data.password && data.password.length >= 8;
13 |     }
14 |     // If it's an existing user and a password IS provided, it must be at least 8 chars.
15 |     // If no password is provided for an existing user, it's valid (means no change).
16 |     if (data.id && data.password) {
17 |         return data.password.length >= 8;
18 |     }
19 |     return true;
20 | }, {
21 |     message: "Password must be at least 8 characters.",
22 |     path: ["password"], // Point the error to the password field
23 | });
24 | 
25 | export type UserFormInput = z.infer<typeof UserFormSchema>;

/lib/logger.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import pino from 'pino';
 2 | 
 3 | const log = pino({
 4 |   level: process.env.LOG_LEVEL || 'info',
 5 |   formatters: {
 6 |     level: (label: string) => ({ level: label }),
 7 |   },
 8 |   timestamp: pino.stdTimeFunctions.isoTime,
 9 | });
10 | 
11 | export default log;


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/neon/api.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // In lib/neon/api.ts
 2 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 3 | import log from '@/lib/logger';
 4 | 
 5 | const NEON_API_BASE = 'https://console.neon.tech/api/v2';
 6 | 
 7 | export async function createNeonProject(tenantId: string) {
 8 |   log.info({ tenantId }, '[NeonAPI] Starting project creation process.');
 9 | 
10 |   const headers = {
11 |     'Authorization': `Bearer ${env.NEON_API_KEY}`,
12 |     'Content-Type': 'application/json',
13 |     'Accept': 'application/json',
14 |   };
15 | 
16 |   const projectResponse = await fetch(`${NEON_API_BASE}/projects`, {
17 |     method: 'POST',
18 |     headers,
19 |     body: JSON.stringify({
20 |       project: { name: `edux-tenant-${tenantId}` },
21 |     }),
22 |   });
23 | 
24 |   if (!projectResponse.ok) {
25 |     const errorBody = await projectResponse.text();
26 |     log.error({ tenantId, status: projectResponse.status, errorBody }, '[NeonAPI] Failed to create project.');
27 |     throw new Error(`Failed to create Neon project: ${errorBody}`);
28 |   }
29 | 
30 |   const responseData = await projectResponse.json();
31 |   const project = responseData.project;
32 |   const connectionDetails = responseData.connection_uris?.[0];
33 |   const connection_uri = connectionDetails?.connection_uri;
34 | 
35 |   if (!connection_uri) {
36 |     log.error({ responseData }, '[NeonAPI] Connection URI could not be extracted from the response.');
37 |     throw new Error('Connection URI could not be extracted from the Neon API response.');
38 |   }
39 | 
40 |   log.info({ tenantId, projectId: project.id }, '[NeonAPI] Project created successfully.');
41 | 
42 |   // The modification to create a pooled string has been removed.
43 |   // We will now return the original, direct connection string.
44 | 
45 |   return {
46 |     projectId: project.id,
47 |     connectionString: connection_uri,
48 |   };
49 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/server/tenant.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // lib/server/tenant.ts
 2 | import { mainDb } from '@/lib/db';
 3 | import { tenants } from '@/lib/db/schema/shared';
 4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 5 | 
 6 | export async function validateTenant(tenantId: string) {
 7 |   console.log(`[Tenant] Validating tenant: ${tenantId}`);
 8 |   const results = await mainDb.select().from(tenants).where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId)).limit(1);
 9 |   const tenant = results[0];
10 | 
11 |   if (!tenant) {
12 |     console.error(`[Tenant] Invalid tenant: ${tenantId}`);
13 |     throw new Error('Tenant not found');
14 |   }
15 | 
16 |   return tenant;
17 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/session.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { cookies } from 'next/headers';
 2 | import { redirect } from 'next/navigation';
 3 | import { verify } from 'jsonwebtoken';
 4 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 5 | import log from './logger';
 6 | 
 7 | export interface UserSession {
 8 |   tenantId: string;
 9 |   userId: number;
10 |   email: string;
11 |   name: string;
12 | }
13 | 
14 | /**
15 |  * Retrieves the session from the auth token cookie.
16 |  * Redirects to '/login' if the token is missing or invalid.
17 |  * This function should be used in Server Components and Server Actions to protect routes.
18 |  * @returns {Promise<UserSession>} The decoded user session.
19 |  */
20 | export async function getSession(): Promise<UserSession> {
21 |   const token = (await cookies()).get('authToken')?.value;
22 | 
23 |   if (!token) {
24 |     redirect('/login');
25 |   }
26 | 
27 |   try {
28 |     // Verify the token and return the session payload
29 |     const session = verify(token, env.JWT_SECRET) as UserSession;
30 |     return session;
31 |   } catch (e) {
32 |     log.error({ error: e }, 'Invalid session token. Redirecting to login.');
33 |     // If verification fails, redirect to login
34 |     redirect('/login');
35 |   }
36 | }


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/lib/utils.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1 | import { clsx, type ClassValue } from "clsx"
2 | import { twMerge } from "tailwind-merge"
3 | 
4 | export function cn(...inputs: ClassValue[]) {
5 |   return twMerge(clsx(inputs))
6 | }
7 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/middleware.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
 2 | import logger from './lib/logger';
 3 | 
 4 | // Extracts the tenant ID from the hostname.
 5 | const getTenantId = (host: string): string | null => {
 6 |   const parts = host.split('.');
 7 | 
 8 |   // Handles tenant.localhost:3000 in development
 9 |   if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'development' && parts.length === 2 && parts[1].startsWith('localhost')) {
10 |     return parts[0];
11 |   }
12 | 
13 |   // Handles tenant.example.com in production
14 |   if (process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production' && parts.length > 1 && parts[0] !== 'www') {
15 |     return parts[0];
16 |   }
17 | 
18 |   return null;
19 | };
20 | 
21 | 
22 | export function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
23 |   const host = request.headers.get('host') || '';
24 |   const tenantId = getTenantId(host);
25 |   const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;
26 |   const log = logger.child({ tenantId, pathname });
27 | 
28 |   log.info('Middleware processing request');
29 | 
30 |   console.log('Incoming cookies:', request.cookies.getAll());
31 |   console.log('TenantId:', tenantId, 'Pathname:', pathname);
32 | 
33 |   const headers = new Headers(request.headers);
34 |   if (tenantId) {
35 |     headers.set('x-tenant-id', tenantId);
36 |   }
37 | 
38 |   // Allow public routes regardless of tenant.
39 |   if (pathname === '/' || pathname === '/signup') {
40 |     return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
41 |   }
42 | 
43 |   // If on a tenant subdomain, allow access to login.
44 |   if (tenantId && pathname.startsWith('/login')) {
45 |       return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
46 |   }
47 | 
48 |   // All API routes are allowed to pass through for now;
49 |   // authentication will be handled at the route level.
50 |   if (pathname.startsWith('/api')) {
51 |     return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
52 |   }
53 | 
54 |   // For dashboard access, check for an auth token.
55 |   const token = request.cookies.get('authToken');
56 |   if (pathname.startsWith('/dashboard') && !token) {
57 |     log.warn('Access to dashboard denied without token, redirecting to login.');
58 |     const loginUrl = new URL('/login', request.url);
59 |     return NextResponse.redirect(loginUrl);
60 |   }
61 | 
62 |   return NextResponse.next({ request: { headers } });
63 | }
64 | 
65 | export const config = {
66 |   matcher: [
67 |     /*
68 |      * Match all request paths except for the ones starting with:
69 |      * - _next/static (static files)
70 |      * - _next/image (image optimization files)
71 |      * - favicon.ico (favicon file)
72 |      */
73 |     '/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico).*)',
74 |   ],
75 | };


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/next.config.mjs:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1 | /** @type {import('next').NextConfig} */
2 | const nextConfig = {
3 |   reactStrictMode: true,
4 |   transpilePackages: ['geist'], // Required for Geist font to work correctly
5 | };
6 | 
7 | export default nextConfig;

  99 | 
 100 | 
 101 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 102 | /README.md:
 103 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 104 | 1 | <!-- run psgl inside docker container -->
 105 | 2 | docker exec -it eduspace-postgres psql -U eduspace_user -d eduspace_db
 106 | 3 | 
 107 | 
 108 | 
 109 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 110 | /app/api/auth/login/route.ts:
 111 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 112 |  1 | // app/api/auth/login/route.ts
 113 |  2 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
 114 |  3 | import { getTenantDb } from '@/lib/db';
 115 |  4 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 116 |  5 | import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';
 117 |  6 | import jwt from 'jsonwebtoken';
 118 |  7 | import { LoginDto } from '@/lib/dto/tenant';
 119 |  8 | import { validateTenant } from '@/lib/server/tenant';
 120 |  9 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 121 | 10 | 
 122 | 11 | export const runtime = 'nodejs';
 123 | 12 | 
 124 | 13 | export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
 125 | 14 |   try {
 126 | 15 |     const tenantId = request.headers.get('x-tenant-id');
 127 | 16 |     if (!tenantId) {
 128 | 17 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant required' }, { status: 400 });
 129 | 18 |     }
 130 | 19 | 
 131 | 20 |     // Validate tenant existence
 132 | 21 |     await validateTenant(tenantId);
 133 | 22 | 
 134 | 23 |     const body = await request.json();
 135 | 24 |     const data = LoginDto.parse(body);
 136 | 25 | 
 137 | 26 |     console.log(`[API] Login attempt for tenant: ${tenantId}, email: ${data.email}`);
 138 | 27 | 
 139 | 28 |     const { db: tenantDb, schema } = await getTenantDb(tenantId);
 140 | 29 |     const users = await tenantDb.select().from(schema.users).where(eq(schema.users.email, data.email)).limit(1);
 141 | 30 | 
 142 | 31 |     if (!users.length) {
 143 | 32 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Invalid credentials' }, { status: 401 });
 144 | 33 |     }
 145 | 34 | 
 146 | 35 |     const user = users[0];
 147 | 36 |     const match = await bcrypt.compare(data.password, user.password);
 148 | 37 |     if (!match) {
 149 | 38 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Invalid credentials' }, { status: 401 });
 150 | 39 |     }
 151 | 40 | 
 152 | 41 |     const token = jwt.sign({ tenantId, userId: user.id }, env.JWT_SECRET, { expiresIn: '1h' });
 153 | 42 | 
 154 | 43 |     const response = NextResponse.json({ message: 'Login successful' });
 155 | 44 |     response.cookies.set('authToken', token, { httpOnly: true, secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === 'production', sameSite: 'strict', maxAge: 3600 });
 156 | 45 |     return response;
 157 | 46 |   } catch (err) {
 158 | 47 |     console.error('[API] Login failed:', err);
 159 | 48 |     if (err instanceof Error && err.message === 'Tenant not found') {
 160 | 49 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant not found' }, { status: 404 });
 161 | 50 |     }
 162 | 51 |     return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Internal error' }, { status: 500 });
 163 | 52 |   }
 164 | 53 | }
 165 | 
 166 | 
 167 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 168 | /app/api/tenants/route.ts:
 169 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 170 |  1 | // app/api/tenants/route.ts
 171 |  2 | import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from 'next/server';
 172 |  3 | import { sharedDb, getTenantDb, executeRawQuery } from '@/lib/db';
 173 |  4 | import { tenants } from '@/lib/db/schema/shared';
 174 |  5 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 175 |  6 | import bcrypt from 'bcrypt';
 176 |  7 | import { TenantSignupDto } from '@/lib/dto/tenant';
 177 |  8 | import z from 'zod/v4';
 178 |  9 | 
 179 | 10 | export const runtime = 'nodejs';
 180 | 11 | 
 181 | 12 | export async function POST(request: NextRequest) {
 182 | 13 |   try {
 183 | 14 |     const body = await request.json();
 184 | 15 |     const data = TenantSignupDto.parse(body);
 185 | 16 |     const tenantId = data.tenantId; 
 186 | 17 |     const schemaName = `tenant_${tenantId}`;
 187 | 18 | 
 188 | 19 |     console.log(`[API] Creating tenant: ${tenantId}, schema: ${schemaName}`);
 189 | 20 | 
 190 | 21 |     const existing = await sharedDb.select().from(tenants).where(eq(tenants.tenantId, tenantId));
 191 | 22 |     if (existing.length) {
 192 | 23 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Tenant ID already exists' }, { status: 409 });
 193 | 24 |     }
 194 | 25 | 
 195 | 26 |     // Create schema and users table
 196 | 27 |     await executeRawQuery(`CREATE SCHEMA IF NOT EXISTS "${schemaName}";`);
 197 | 28 |     await executeRawQuery(`
 198 | 29 |       CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "${schemaName}".users (
 199 | 30 |         id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
 200 | 31 |         name TEXT NOT NULL,
 201 | 32 |         email TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
 202 | 33 |         password TEXT NOT NULL
 203 | 34 |       );
 204 | 35 |     `);
 205 | 36 | 
 206 | 37 |     // Insert tenant metadata
 207 | 38 |     await sharedDb.insert(tenants).values({
 208 | 39 |       tenantId,
 209 | 40 |       schemaName,
 210 | 41 |       name: data.orgName,
 211 | 42 |     });
 212 | 43 | 
 213 | 44 |     // Insert admin user
 214 | 45 |     const { db: tenantDb, schema } = await getTenantDb(tenantId);
 215 | 46 |     const hashedPassword = await bcrypt.hash(data.adminPassword, 12);  // Stronger salt (12 rounds)
 216 | 47 |     await tenantDb.insert(schema.users).values({
 217 | 48 |       name: data.adminName,
 218 | 49 |       email: data.adminEmail,
 219 | 50 |       password: hashedPassword,
 220 | 51 |     });
 221 | 52 | 
 222 | 53 |     console.log(`[API] Tenant created successfully: ${tenantId}`);
 223 | 54 |     return NextResponse.json({ message: 'Tenant created', tenantId });
 224 | 55 |   } catch (err) {
 225 | 56 |     console.error('[API] Tenant creation failed:', err);
 226 | 57 |     if (err instanceof z.ZodError) {
 227 | 58 |       return NextResponse.json({ error: err }, { status: 400 });
 228 | 59 |     }
 229 | 60 |     return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Internal error' }, { status: 500 });
 230 | 61 |   }
 231 | 62 | }
 232 | 
 233 | 
 234 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 235 | /app/dashboard/page.tsx:
 236 | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 237 |  1 | // app/dashboard/page.tsx
 238 |  2 | import { cookies } from 'next/headers';
 239 |  3 | import { verify } from 'jsonwebtoken';
 240 |  4 | import { getTenantDb } from '@/lib/db';
 241 |  5 | 
 242 |  6 | import { eq } from 'drizzle-orm';
 243 |  7 | import { env } from '@/env.mjs';
 244 |  8 | 
 245 |  9 | export const runtime = 'nodejs';  // Node runtime
 246 | 10 | 
 247 | 11 | export default async function DashboardPage() {
 248 | 12 |   const cookieStore = cookies();
 249 | 13 |   const token = (await cookieStore).get('authToken')?.value;
 250 | 14 |   if (!token) {
 251 | 15 |     return <div>Unauthorized</div>;
 252 | 16 |   }
 253 | 17 | 
 254 | 18 |   let decoded;
 255 | 19 |   try {
 256 | 20 |     decoded = verify(token, env.JWT_SECRET) as { tenantId: string; userId: number };
 257 | 21 | 
 258 | 22 |     const { db: tenantDb, schema } = await getTenantDb(decoded.tenantId);
 259 | 23 |     const user = await tenantDb.select().from(schema.users).where(eq(schema.users.id, decoded.userId)).limit(1);
 260 | 24 | 
 261 | 25 |     return (
 262 | 26 |       <div className="min-h-screen p-8 bg-gray-100">
 263 | 27 |         <h1 className="text-3xl">Welcome to {decoded.tenantId} Dashboard</h1>
 264 | 28 |         <p>Email: {user[0]?.email}</p>
 265 | 29 |       </div>
 266 | 30 |     );
 267 | 31 |   } catch (err) {
 268 | 32 |     if (err === 'Tenant not found') {
 269 | 33 |       return <div>Tenant not found</div>;
 270 | 34 |     }
 271 | 35 |     return <div>Invalid token</div>;
 272 | 36 |   }
 273 | 37 | }
